abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Conakry Port Project
            for Guinea was successful. The project achieved its main
            objectives, its impact on institutional development has been
            substantial, sustainability is likely, and the performance
            of both the Bank and Borrower was very good. Several lessons
            can be learned from this project. They are that excellent
            results can be obtained in resurrecting a badly rundown,
            mismanaged Government-owned entity in a poor country
            provided that: 1) sound feasibility studies and good quality
            detailed engineering and supervision are carried out; 2) a
            competent contractor is engaged to carry out the work; 3)
            the Government and its executing agency are cooperative; 4)
            all co-lenders closely coordinate their efforts and
            thoroughly monitor progress; and 5) the project is
            well-conceived from the beginning.
